linkTarget.anchoringText: Managed pressure drilling(MPD) is a widely used advanced drilling technology, which can effectively solve many drilling problems related to borehole pressure, such as circulation leakage, serious gas kick and narrow density window. Although MPD technology is very powerful, its application is based on the existence of certain positive security density windows. If there are negative density windows in the strata,, which occurs leakage in the upper section and collapse in the lower section. As shown in Figure.1. The conventional MPD technology will become powerless. This paper presents a new Gas-Lift MPD technology based on Dual-Channel Drillpipe, which can effectively solve the problem of negative density window.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Analysis of the formation safety density window

formatted-caption.caption-text: Analysis of the formation safety density window

linkTarget.anchoringText: Gas-Lift MPD drilling is a new technology that uses a small number of Dual-Channel Drillpipe to lift up the annular space drilling fluid in the upper well and reduce the ECD to drill though the leaky strata. Figure 2 shows how it works. It is developed from aerated underbalanced drilling, and the key is accuratly controlling of wellbore ECD profile.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Gas-lift MPD Based On Dual-Channel Drillpipe

formatted-caption.caption-text: Gas-lift MPD Based On Dual-Channel Drillpipe

linkTarget.anchoringText: Dual-channel Drillpipe (DCP) is one of the key equipment of Gas lift MPD technology. The DCP is composed of the 139.7mm DCP, the gas lift joint and the conventional 139.7mm drill pipe. It has two circulating channels shown in Figure 3. Channel 1 is for drilling fluid circulation and Channel 2 is directly connected with the upper borehole annulus.
Other main equipments include: gas liquid double injection special adapter, air compressor, Dual-Channel square Drillpipe, etc. as shown in figures 4 and 5.
Other main equipments include: gas liquid double injection special adapter, air compressor, Dual-Channel square Drillpipe, etc. as shown in figures 4 and 5.

Under the same pressure reduction, with the increase of well depth, the half parabolic profiles of ECD can appear in different depths of annulus,as shown in Figure 6. Under the principle that the Upper formation ECD is always less than the leakage pressure of the formation, the accurate continuous control of the annular ECD section is achieved by adjusting the flow of the injected gas, the depth of the double channel drill rod, the drilling fluid flow and the density of the drilling fluid. Keeping the Lower formation annulus ECD is always greater than its collapse pressure and improving its wellbore stability. Thus, the problem of negative density window drilling is solved. Annular pressure profile, as shown in Figure 7.

Under the same pressure reduction, with the increase of well depth, the half parabolic profiles of ECD can appear in different depths of annulus,as shown in Figure 6. Under the principle that the Upper formation ECD is always less than the leakage pressure of the formation, the accurate continuous control of the annular ECD section is achieved by adjusting the flow of the injected gas, the depth of the double channel drill rod, the drilling fluid flow and the density of the drilling fluid. Keeping the Lower formation annulus ECD is always greater than its collapse pressure and improving its wellbore stability. Thus, the problem of negative density window drilling is solved. Annular pressure profile, as shown in Figure 7.

The Shun Bei oil field is located in the central and Western Tarim Basin and is located in the desert area of Gobi desert on the northern edge of the Taklimakan Desert. The surface is mainly desert and floating soil, and the elevation is usually between 950 and 990m. The regional structure is located in the Shun Tuo Guo Le low uplift tectonic zone, spanning Shun Tuo Guo Le low uplift and two depressions of the East and the West, the South adjacent to katalone and the northern part of the Sha Ya uplift. It includes 4 blocks: Shun Bei, Shun Tuo, Shun Xi and Ah Dong, covering an area of about 20 thousand square kilometers. As shown in Figure 8.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: the distribution map of the structural position of the Shun Bei oil field

formatted-caption.caption-text: the distribution map of the structural position of the Shun Bei oil field

linkTarget.anchoringText: According to the characteristics of stratum and the need of exploration and development, the four levels well body structure is commonly used in the ShunBei oil field, as shown in Figure 9.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: the four level well structure of the Shun Bei oil field

formatted-caption.caption-text: the four level well structure of the Shun Bei oil field

linkTarget.anchoringText: According to the analysis of completed well data, there are many fractures in the Permian igneous strata. The loss ECD is lower, and the requirement is less than 1.29g/cm3. However, the collapse ECD of the underpart Silurian hard brittle mudstone strata is higher than the 1.31g/cm3. In the course of drilling, if both of them are in the same open hole section, there is a negative density window of 0.03-0.05 g/cm3. It is difficult to use a single drilling fluid density system in conventional drilling. As shown in Figure 10:

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: the Permian - Silurian negative density window

formatted-caption.caption-text: the Permian - Silurian negative density window

linkTarget.anchoringText: In the early stage, pressure bearing plugging technology was used to improve the bearing capacity of Permian strata. The construction of 3 wells has been completed. The effect is shown in Figure 11.

image-wrap.label: Figure 11
image-wrap.caption: the effect of the Pre-Drill Planning

formatted-caption.caption-text: the effect of the Pre-Drill Planning

linkTarget.anchoringText: It is very limited to improve the bearing capacity of the Permian strata by pressure plugging technology, and the maximum pressure ECD is about 1.32g/cm3, and the repeated leakage phenomenon is serious, reaching more than 80%.

In this paper, the flow path model (e.g. figure 14)of SBX-5H Gas-Lift MPD technology is established on the basis of SBX-5H drilling design, combined with field equipment and flow connection, as shown in Figure 13.

In this paper, the flow path model (e.g. figure 14)of SBX-5H Gas-Lift MPD technology is established on the basis of SBX-5H drilling design, combined with field equipment and flow connection, as shown in Figure 13.

According to the established flow path model, through adjusting various drilling parameters, the construction process of the drilling cycle and non-cycle working conditions of the gas lift MPD is simulated. At the same time, the changing rules and trends of the key parameters in each construction process are calculated and analyzed, which can be used to accurately control the change of the ECD profile of the well. as shown in Figure 15.

image-wrap.label: Figure 15
image-wrap.caption: Simulation of Gas-lift MPD construction process

formatted-caption.caption-text: Simulation of Gas-lift MPD construction process

linkTarget.anchoringText: The simulation analysis show that it has great advantages in reducing the number of casing layers, shortening the drilling cycle and enlarging the completion size. Firstly, the control requirements of the ECD profileare is satisfied, which is that the ECD<1.28g/cm3 in the upper section and ECD>1.32g/cm3 in the bottom of the open hole (collapse ECD=1.31g/cm3, leakage ECD=1.29cm3) by simulating and adjusting drilling pump flow, injected gas flow rate, Dual-Channel Dirllpipe length and drilling fluid density. As shown in Figures 16:

image-wrap.label: Figure 16
image-wrap.caption: Control parameters of simulation the ECD profile

formatted-caption.caption-text: Control parameters of simulation the ECD profile

linkTarget.anchoringText: Secondly, the complicated drilling problem is expected to be solved,such as repeated leakage in the long open hole section. The number of casing layers can be further reduced from 4 to 3 and the drilling cycle is expected to be reduced by more than 20%. Finally, the completion well bore size will be expanded from 149.2mm to 165.1mm (enlarged 11%), which can better meet the requirements of the next production and reservoir transformation. as shown in Figures 17:
